metadata.title: CVE-2022-29536 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In GNOME Epiphany before 41.4 and 42.x before 42.2, an HTML document cantrigger a client buffer overflow (in ephy_string_shorten in the UI process)via a long page title. The issue occurs because the number of bytes for aUTF-8 ellipsis character is not properly considered.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29536` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

epiphany-browser - 3.36.4-0ubuntu2
epiphany-browser-data - 3.36.4-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: epiphany-browser package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.36.4-0ubuntu2').
